text: Australia at the Olympics is a history which includes 45 games in 22 countries and 3,000+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Australia" ; retrieved 2012-7-29. Since 1895, Australia has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement". Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-29. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Australia is AUS. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== The Australia National Olympic Committee was formed in 1895. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1895.Australia; retrieved 2012-7-29. Afghanistan's team first competed at the 1896 Summer Olympics in Athens. Australia has sent athletes to almost all of the modern Olympic Games. Australia has competed in every Summer Olympic Games, and most Winter Olympic Games. In 1908 and 1912, Australia competed with New Zealand under the name Australasia.SR/Olympics, "Australasia" ; retrieved 2012-7-29. ==Host country== Australia has hosted the Olympics twice: The 1956 Summer Olympics were at Melbourne in Victoria.SR/Olympics, "1956 Melbourne Summer Games" ; retrieved 2012-7-29. The 2000 Summer Olympics were at Sydney in New South Wales.SR/Olympics, "1956 Sydney Summer Games" ; retrieved 2012-7-29. ==Medal tables== ===Medals by Summer Games=== Games Athletes Gold Silver
